The incident on November 4: 2008, where New Black Panther Party members were accused of voter intimidation outside a Philadelphia polling place.
The Department of Justice filing a civil: 3. The Department of Justice dropping the case against all defendants except for King Samir Shabazz, who was prohibited from displaying a weapon near a polling location.
The opinions of Fox News pundits: such as Bill O'Reilly and Lis Wiehl, who believed that the Department of Justice should have pursued criminal charges against the New Black Panther Party members involved in the incident.
